sprite.name: Big Boo
sprite.notes: A large version of the Boo enemy.

checkbox.title: Slightly Faster
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Big Boo will move slightly faster.

checkbox.title: Always Despawn
checkbox.comment: When disabled, the Big Boo will only despawn if it's off-screen and not moving. When enabled, it will despawn when it's off screen regardless of whether it's moving.

checkbox.title: Place over other sprites
checkbox.comment: If checked, 300 units will be added to each Boo's position. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Cosmic Mario
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Race Recorder
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Boo
sprite.notes: A standard loose Boo enemy. The Boo will chase the player when there is no player actively facing the Boo.

checkbox.title: Slightly Faster
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Boo will move slightly faster towards the player.

checkbox.title: Always Despawn
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Boo will despawn when it's off screen regardless of whether it's moving. When disabled, the Boo will only despawn if it's off-screen and not moving.

checkbox.title: Place over other sprites
checkbox.comment: If checked, 300 units will be added to each Boo's position. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

list.title: Contains
list.comment: Unlisted values are Empty. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 (1)
checkbox.comment: Used in Retail: 06-05 A2. Possibly distance related.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

list.title: Target Layer
list.comment: This determines which terrain layer is affected. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own effect in its place.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own sound in its place.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Tileset Row
value.comment: When using [Tile: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

value.title: Tileset Column
value.comment: When using [Block Type: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

sprite.name: ? Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard Question Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn enough for every player! Such a generous block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2: Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown. Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the ?-Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: (Unused) ? Block
sprite.notes: This is a nearly identical version of [207] to the point that you should probably just be using [207]...

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

sprite.name: Brick Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard brown Brick Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a stingy block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the Brick Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Brick Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Brick Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: It is recommended to use [403] Line Controlled Brick Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Brick Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: Invisible Block
sprite.notes: Your most sneaky, most annoying, hidden transparent Invisible Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a rude block~
sprite.advancednotes: The tileset-based Invisible Blocks can be destroyed by sprites like Bob-ombs. Sprite-based Invisible Blocks however cannot be destroyed.

dependency.notes: If pairing the Invisible Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will only release one power-up item. If the invisible block has 10 coins, it will stay in the used block graphic the entire time. Additionally, it won't release the extra few coins if the block is hit multiple times successfully.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Invisible Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Invisible Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Invisible Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: Purple Coin
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: ID
value.comment: Each purple coin must have its own ID in a level.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Purple Coin will be assigned.

value.title: Water Ball ID
value.comment: If pairing the Purple Coin with sprite 205, match the Water Ball ID to enable Water Ball synchronized movement.

value.title: Collection ID
value.comment: If pairing the Purple Coin with sprite 459/461, match the Collection ID to have the game count this Purple Coin towards the Collection Set.

sprite.name: Plus/Minus Clock
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: ID
value.comment: Each plus clock must have its own ID in a level.

dualbox.comment: Determine if time will be added or subtracted to the timer upon hitting this sprite.

value.title: Time Added
value.comment: The amount of seconds that will be added to the game's timer.

value.title: Time Subtracted
value.comment: The amount of seconds that will be subtracted to the game's timer.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled ? Block
sprite.notes: A ?-Block that can either be moved by rotation controllers or manually angled.

dependency.notes: A rotation controller is not required for this sprite to function. You can, instead, set a manual angle for the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the ?-Block to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: Tilt Angle
list.comment: This determines the angle the block will be tilted. Tiled blocks can't be rotation controlled.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players. Some items, such as the Spring, won't appear if the player strikes the Block while it is actively rotating.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: A Brick Block that can either be moved by rotation controllers or manually angled.

dependency.notes: A rotation controller is not required for this sprite to function. You can, instead, set a manual angle for the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Brick Block to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: Tilt Angle
list.comment: This determines the angle the block will be tilted. Tilted blocks can not be rotation controlled.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will only release one power-up item. Some items, such as the Spring, won't appear if the player strikes the Block while it is actively rotating.

sprite.name: Ghost House Door
sprite.notes: A Ghost House door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

value.title: Model ID
value.comment: This determines the model used by the ghost house door. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the Model ID is set to 0, the model that will be used will be "obj_obake_door.mdl0".
Otherwise, say x is the Model ID, the model that will be used will be "obj_obake_door_x.mdl0".

checkbox.title: Fake Door
checkbox.comment: When enabled, when the player attempt to enter the door, it will vanish and disperse into 4 harmless Boos.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Special Event
sprite.notes: This sprite can do all sorts of special functions, such as freezing actors, changing the size of sprites, editing the game Timer, and changing the gravity. This function is restricted to the active Zone. The settings available to each type will appear when selecting that option. Be sure to reset the Sprite Settings when switching between different types in order to prevent any bugs. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Special Event is on as long as this Event is activated.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the effect of the Special Event.
list.comment2:
Time Stop: Freezes some Actors/Elements.
Pause Timer: Pauses the Level's Clock, different from Time Stop.
Set Timer: Changes the time on the Level's Clock.
Change Gravity: Changes player physics to simulate a different type of gravity.
Resizer: Changes the size of all sprites affected by this function.
Selective Resizer: Changes the size of sprites affected by this function to their specified sizes.
Background Resizer: Changes the Background settings.
Disable Z-Order Fixes: Deactivates all Z-Order modifications while the Special Event is activated.
Disable MP Bubbling: Deactivates the ability to 'bubble' yourself during Multiplayer.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Platforms
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Platforms that support this function.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Players
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Players.
checkbox.comment2: Remember to deactivate the Special Event or else Mario and the other Players will remain frozen. Forever~

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Terrain
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Terrain Animations.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Enemies
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Enemies that support this function.

list.title: Gravity Type
list.comment: This determines what the altered state of gravity will be while the Special Event is activated.
list.comment2: Anti Gravity is a little strange, not fully documented, and definitely not recommended for normal use.

value.title: Set Time to...
value.comment: This determines what the Level's Clock will be set to when the Special Event is activated.
value.comment2: Do not use a value higher than 999.

list.title: Scale / Size (Global)
list.comment: The Special Event will resize all affected sprites in the Zone that support this function.

list.title: Scale / Size (Selective)
list.comment:
The Special Event will resize all affected sprites in the Zone following the list below using nybble 5 or 7. Keep in mind that these nybbles may control other functions in the sprites themselves.
4 = x0.25
5 = x0.5
6 = x0.75
0-3 = x1.0
7 = x1.25
8 = x1.5
9 = x2.0
10 = x2.5
11 = x3.0
12 = x4.0
13 = x5.0
14 = x6.0
15 = x10.0

list.title: bgA (Scenery) X Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Scenery' background picture horizontally. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgA (Scenery) Y Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Scenery' background picture vertically. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgB (Backdrop) X Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Backdrop' background picture horizontally. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgB (Backdrop) Y Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Backdrop' background picture vertically. Higher Values = Bigger Size

sprite.name: Power Star
sprite.notes: Acts as the level ending sprite. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The star will appear when this event is triggered. If it is set to 0, the star will be there by default.

checkbox.title: No Camera Shift
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the camera won't be moved when the star appears

checkbox.title: Castle Star
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, collecting the star will play the boss clear fanfare, and rendering will be forced
checkbox.comment2: Not recommended for use, internally used for koopalings

checkbox.title: Grand Star
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Power Star's model will be changed to a Grand Star's, and the glowing effect will be twice as big.

checkbox.title: No music
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, no music will play after the Power Star is donne appearing.

value.title: Camera center Y padding
value.comment: When being triggered; the camera will center on the star by default. However, you can make it center a set number of tiles higher using this setting.

sprite.name: Cosmic Clone
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The Cosmic Clone with spawn with a Delay of this number of frames.

sprite.name: 4-Way Large Cannon with Pipe
sprite.notes: A large 4-way rotating cannonball launcher that has a pipe in place of one of the four cannons.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the cannonball moves relative to the camera.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the cannon and pipe will rotate.

list.title: Pipe Position at Load
list.comment: This determines the pipe's position when the cannon first loads on the screen.

value.title: Pipe BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon is upside-down and can be placed against the ceiling.
checkbox.advancedcomment: The pipe will load on the opposite side alongside a cannon, leaving a hole on one side. As such, this option should not be used.

sprite.name: Signboard - Arrow
sprite.notes: A signboard with a red arrow on it, useful for suggesting a player travel in a specific direction.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will point in.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Signboard placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Model ID
value.comment: This determines the model used by the arrow signboard. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the Model ID is set to 0, the model that will be used will be "kanban_yajirushi.mdl0".
Otherwise, say x is the Model ID, the model that will be used will be "kanban_yajirushi_x.mdl0".

value.title: Text ID
value.comment: If >0, a text of the entered ID (see in the code) will display if a player gets close to the arrow signboard. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Chimp House Minigame - Item Bowling
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Room Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the room

sprite.name: Chimp House Minigame - Item Balloon
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

list.title: Item
list.comment: This determines which item does the balloon correspond to.

sprite.name: Boo Circle
sprite.notes: A circle of Boos that can rotate along a central point. It will always have one opening for the player to pass through.

value.title: Greater Radius Distance
value.comment: This determines the maximum radius of the Boo Circle. It must be larger or equal to the Lesser Radius.

value.title: Lesser Radius Distance
value.comment: This determines the minimum radius of the Boo Circle. It must be smaller or equal to the Greater Radius.

value.title: Shrink/Expand Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay between shrinking/expanding, if the Radius Distances are not equal. A value of 1 is approximately equal to one game second.

list.title: Shrink/Expand Effects
list.comment: This determines the speed (or other effects used) when shrinking/expanding. This speed is not influenced by the distance of the radius they travel.
list.comment2:
Instant: The boos will flicker instantly between the greater and lesser radius distance.
Vanish: On load, the boos will fade out from their greater radius distance and will not return.
Go Offscreen: On load, the boos will fly from their greater radius distance through the middle of the circle and through the other side until they are completely off screen and will not return.

checkbox.title: Place over other sprites
checkbox.comment: If checked, 300 units will be added to each Boo's position. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Rolling Hill - 1 Pipe
sprite.notes: A rotating circle with one pipe in it that has the same general appearance as the standard Grass or Underground tilesets.

dependency.notes: A functioning entrance is required to be associated with the Rolling Hill or the game will crash. Also, the underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

dualbox.comment: This determines which texture the Rolling Hill will use.

value.title: Pipe BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: This determines the initial angle the hill spawns at before spinning. It measures clockwise.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the rotation speed of the Rolling Hill. A value of 5 matches Mario's running speed, so use of higher values isn't recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Rolling Hill in relation to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill - 8 Pipes
sprite.notes: A rotating circle with eight pipes in it that only has the same general appearance of the standard Grass tilesets.

dependency.notes: A functioning entrance is required to be associated with the Rolling Hill or the game will crash. Also, the underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

value.title: Pipe BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: This determines the initial angle the hill spawns at before spinning. It measures clockwise. Keep in mind that odd values will set the pipes to be invisible.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the rotation speed of the Rolling Hill. A value of 5 matches Mario's running speed, so use of higher values isn't recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Rolling Hill in relation to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

checkbox.title: Invisible Pipes
checkbox.advancedcomment: When enabled, the Pipes will be invisible, but still able to be entered. It was likely meant to be another texture, but was never actually added in. Do not use this setting.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Tower Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi plays an unused animation when he enters the area from a Boss Entrance. However, he lacks proper compatibility with the bosses themselves.
sprite.notes: This controls the level completion for the World 1-7 Tower battles, as well as the listed Koopaling's initial movements. Koopalings function without this controller, but they won't move until hit, and the level won't end when they are defeated.

dependency.notes: An appropriate loose Koopaling is required in order for the controller to do what it needs to. It's also required to place the sprite on a spot without terrain. See Retail X-22 for suggested room builds for Tower bosses.

list.title: Tower Boss
list.comment: This determines which Koopaling you will be fighting. When that Koopaling is defeated, the level will end.

checkbox.title: Don't look at the boss when it dies
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the player won't look at the boss after they kill the boss. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Effect - Snow and Wind
sprite.notes: This effect controller will either create falling snow, or it will create a Sandstorm.

dependency.notes: If this sprite is placed more than once in the same Zone, the game will crash. If Sandstorm is selected, you must include [90] Wind Physics and Sound.

dualbox.comment: This determines the functionality of the sprite.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Sandstorm. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Color
value.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Down
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Color
value.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Right
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Color
value.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Left
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Color
value.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Propeller Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable propeller block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. It can also boost the player into the air like a Propeller Cap if the player shakes their controller a second time while holding it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly.

checkbox.title: Do not despawn
checkbox.comment: If ticked, the glow block does not despawn once it has gone off-screen. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
checkbox.comment2: Every nonzero value has the same effect.

sprite.name: Line Controlled ? Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the ? Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: Use the Group Controller [236] for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Group Controller for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the Brick Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: Use the Group Controller [236] for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Group Controller for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi plays an unused animation when he enters the area from a Boss Entrance. However, he lacks proper compatibility with the bosses themselves.
sprite.notes: This controls the various boss fight mechanics for the corresponding Koopaling boss fight, such as the cutscenes, boss movement, shutter doors, camera options, and boss collision when the fight begins.

dependency.notes: For help in placement of the Boss Controller and Koopaling Castle Boss, see the desired Castle Boss' room in the retail level.

list.title: Boss
list.comment: Select the boss that matches the setup you are creating.

checkbox.title: Use Star
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the boss will drop a power star instead of a key. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Floating ? Block
sprite.notes: A slightly-larger-than-normal ? Block that floats on the surface of the Zone's non-Location Water, Raft Water, Poisoned Water, or Lava.

dependency.notes: Place this block at the horizontal position you want it to load, and it will spawn floating at the surface line of the body of liquid. It only works with the non-Location liquid sprites listed below.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Lighting - Underwater Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative aquatic lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default. It does not have to be used with water, it just happens to have a ship motif.

value.title: Model ID
value.comment: This determines the model used by the lamp. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the Model ID is set to 0, the model that will be used will be "shinkai_light.mdl0".
Otherwise, say x is the Model ID, the model that will be used will be "shinkai_light_x.mdl0".

list.title: Power
list.comment: This determines the power of the light emmited by the sprite. 100% = 266 units = 16.625 tiles. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Enterable Warp Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that can be entered or exited from. Only one facing upwards exists. It does not have to be placed exactly on the grid.

value.title: BRRES ID
value.comment: This determines the BRRES file used by the pipe. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the BRRES ID is set to 0, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan.brres".
Otherwise, say x is the BRRES ID, the BRRES file that will be used will be "g3d/obj_dokan_x.brres".

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Color
value.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines which Entrance is paired with the pipe.

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #1
sprite.notes: A controller that generates a clapping sound when the player collects the listed number of coins of both types from the Collection ID group.

dependency.notes: You cannot use tileset coins for this to function.

value.title: # of Blue Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired blue coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Yellow Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired standard coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Purple Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired purple coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Collection ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Coins with the Crowd Clapper to track their collection.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Crowd Clapping Controller claps, this Event ID will be triggered. Leaving to 0 disables this function. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Crowd Clapping Controller will clap. Leaving to 0 disables this function. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

checkbox.title: Disable SFX
checkbox.comment: Prevents the Crowd Clapping sounds from being played. Useful if you only want to use the Event part. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #2
sprite.notes: A controller that generates a clapping sound when the player collects the listed number of coins of both types from the Collection ID group. Seems to be identical to #1.

dependency.notes: You cannot use tileset coins for this to function.

value.title: # of Blue Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired blue coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Yellow Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired standard coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Purple Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired purple coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Collection ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Coins with the Crowd Clapper to track their collection.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Crowd Clapping Controller claps, this Event ID will be triggered. Leaving to 0 disables this function. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Crowd Clapping Controller will clap. Leaving to 0 disables this function. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

checkbox.title: Disable SFX
checkbox.comment: Prevents the Crowd Clapping sounds from being played. Useful if you only want to use the Event part. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Final Boss - Pre-Boss Camera Effects
sprite.notes: A set of special elements utilized by the sections of level leading up to the final Bowser Boss fight.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: This determines the type of effect used. Other values not listed here crash the game.

value.title: Model ID
value.comment: This determines the model used by the corridor darkness. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the Model ID is set to 0, the model that will be used will be "FrontDoor.mdl0".
Otherwise, say x is the Model ID, the model that will be used will be "FrontDoor_x.mdl0".

sprite.name: Flip Block
sprite.notes: A yellow block with two eyes that cannot be destroyed. When struck, it will spin, allowing passage through it for a limited time. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Sound/Graphic Effects Spawner
sprite.notes:
For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!
Enables event-driven spawning of Sound Effects and Graphic Effects.
Limitations:
1) Do not use 1000 or more sounds/effects per area.
2) A single Event ID can only trigger one sound/effect per area
3) Only a specific number of sounds/effects can be active at the same time
4) Only two BRSTMs can be active at the same time.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the associated sound or affect will be played.

external.title: Sfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Sound Effect.

external.title: Gfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Graphic Effect.

dualbox.comment: This determines if you are spawning a sound effect or a graphical effect. The list of graphical effects is limited to the entries used by Newer. The volume of the sound effect is relative to the distance of the placement of the spawner.
This determines if the sound will play at the position of the sprite, or if it will play globally.

value.title: Loop Delay
value.comment: This determines the number of seconds between activations of the sound or graphic effect.
value.comment2: The effect will only activate once if the delay is left at 0.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Use this to spawn any actor into the game! Anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

dependency.notes:
When not using compatibility mode, this Actor Spawner requires a linked [485] Actor Spawner in Data Bank Mode to store the settings that will be used by the spawned actor.

Additionally, the actor that will be spawned must be placed as a sprite somewhere else in the level in order for the game to know to load the required assets. When trying to spawn an actor without an equivalent sprite, place a sprite that can create that actor into the level.

dualbox.comment: This option exists for compatibility with the original NewerSMBW levels. Choose the second option to access new and improved settings!

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create a copy of the actor at the location of the spawner.
value.comment2: The Triggering Event ID is limited to only the first 15 Event IDs.

checkbox.title: Automatically Respawn
checkbox.comment: When the actor spawned by this spawner is deleted or missing and the event is triggered, another actor with the same settings will be spawned. This also stops the spawned actor from despawning when the event is deactivated.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Enter the Actor ID of the actor you wish to spawn here. If you don't know the ID, use the selection box.

dualbox.comment: A version of this sprite in Spawner Mode will pull data from another version of this sprite in Data Bank Mode with a matching Search ID. Nybbles 1-12 of the Data Bank will be used by the actor spawned by the Actor Spawner.

A version of this sprite in Spawner Mode will pull data from another version of this sprite in Data Bank Mode with a matching Search ID. Nybbles 1-12 of the Data Bank will be used by the actor spawned by the Actor Spawner.

value.title: Search ID
value.comment: Match this ID with a corresponding [485] Actor Spawner. The Actor Spawner will pull nybbles 1-12 from the Data Bank for use when spawning an actor.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create the specified actor at its location.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Enter the Actor ID of the actor you wish to spawn here. If you don't know the ID, use the selection box.

checkbox.title: Multi-Spawn Mode
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will not keep track of the actors it spawns, meaning the event can be toggled on and off to spawn more actors.

checkbox.title: Respawn Automatically
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will automatically respawn the actor if it is deleted or missing.

checkbox.title: Despawn Without Event
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will despawn the actor it spawned when its event is turned off.

checkbox.title: Save Despawn Position
checkbox.comment: When checked, when the Actor Spawner despawns an actor due to its event being turned off it will move to the position the actor was just in. If the event is turned back on, the new actor will be spawned at that position.

list.title: Spawn Delay
list.comment: When not set to Manual, this option will cause the Actor Spawner to wait the specified number of frames after initially spawning an actor before spawning another one. The event will stay on the whole time.
list.comment2: When set to Manual, this option will cause the Actor Spawner to disable its triggering event after spawning an actor so that it can be manually turned back on.
list.advancedcomment: Using Manual will not work when trying to use two Actor Spawners triggered by the same event, because one will disable the event before the other can execute.

value.title: Search ID
value.comment: Match this ID with a corresponding [485] Actor Spawner. The Actor Spawner will pull nybbles 1-12 from the Data Bank for use when spawning an actor.

value.title: Nybble 1
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 1 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 2
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 2 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 3
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 3 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 4
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 4 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 5
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 5 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 6
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 6 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 7
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 7 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 8
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 8 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 9
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 9 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 10
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 10 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 11
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 11 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 12
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 12 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

sprite.name: Magic Platform
sprite.notes: Magic Platforms are created by assigning tileset data on Layer 1 to an invisible block as a new texture, and moving that texture around. While it functions best as a moving platform, the Magic Platform does not have to move in order to perform its function. It can also simply create terrain chunks with a different type of collision than normal. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event is activated, the Magic Platform will move as specified. When the Event is deactivated, the Magic Platform will return to its starting position.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Magic Platform will move.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed at which the Magic Platform will move.
value.comment2: The speed increases by a factor of .2 per increment. It must be set greater than 0 for the Magic Platform to move at all.

checkbox.title: Move Forever
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Magic Platform will move in the assigned direction while the Triggering Event is activated, and will move in the opposite direction while the Triggering Event is deactivated.

list.title: Distance
list.comment: This determines how far the Magic Platform will be moved when the Triggering Event is activated.

sprite.name: BA
sprite.notes: <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Event Controller - Looper (While X, do Y THEN Z+, Repeat)
sprite.notes: Similar to the Multi-Chainer, this controller will activate a sequence of Events ranging from [Target Event ID Start] through [Target Event ID End]. However, it will only activate one event at a time. After activating one event, it will deactivate it and activate the next event. Once it has done this for all events, if the [Triggering Event ID] is still activated, it will return to [Target Event ID Start] and begin again. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event will activate the Event Looper going from the Start ID to the End ID, and back again so long as this event is still active.

value.title: Target Event ID Start
value.comment: When the Triggering Event is activated, this Event ID will be activated first. It will then run until it reaches [Target Event ID End].

value.title: Target Event ID End
value.comment: After enabling and disabling this event, if the Triggering Event is still activated, the Looper will return to [Target Event ID Start] and repeat the loop.

value.title: Delay
value.comment:
This determines the amount of frames the Looper will wait between activating/deactivating each event.

The code for this specifically is a bit messy. The entered value is multiplied by 10, and then 10 is added. However, it can only be a value from 0-255, and any number past that loops. For example, value 24 would be 250 frames of delay.
It's easier to follow these expressions:

0-24 is 'value * 10 + 10' frames
25-50 is (value - 25) * 10 + 4 frames
51-101 is (value - 51) * 10 + 8 frames
102-126 is (value - 102) * 10 + 6.

Finally, value 127 would be 0 frames of delay, and values 128-255 are essentially the same as 0-127.

sprite.name: Talk Balloon Manager
sprite.notes: Place in the zone if you want to use text boxes. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

sprite.name: Purple Coin Checker
sprite.notes: Triggers an event you've got at least a set amount of purple coins. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be triggered once the player has collected at least the number of coins indicated in [Number of coins].

value.title: Number of coins
value.comment: And event will be triggered once the player has collected at least the number of coins indicated here.
